items.content:
Hi Marion, 


Thank you for your submitting request for end-to-end live streaming consultancy from the MPO LIVE team. Our small team supports GBS and their key advertisers that go live on TikTok.


I am happy to hear that your client decided to go live on TT and boost their live with CI to LIVE campaign. 


As mentioned on MPO Livestream Support - FAQ for GBS and PMM, we require at least 2 week notice before the live event. Your request does not meet this requirement. In addition, you requested this weekend support (Saturday) on one of the busiest time for our team - fashion month, in which we support many fashion brands that go live  in a very short period of time. Their CSMs requested our support well in advance.


Our resources are limited as we are team of two members only globally. I am the only one based in Europe time zone. I will be happy to discuss whether we are able to support you and your client with their live stream and if so, what level of support.


To assess this, could you please provide the following important information: 


1) What is the client ad spending budget on CI to Live? 

2) What is their budget for this live stream campaign in total (including pre-live, mid-live and post-live campaigns)?
3) What time on 24 Feb will your client go live and for how long? 

4) What is your client plans for the live stream?

5) Have they gone live on TikTok before?

6) Will they hire production company to produce this live content? If not, whom is going to produce this? 
7) Have they run CI to LIVE campaign before?

8) Do they have an agency that has run CI to LIVE campaign before? 


Looking forward to hearing from you back. 


Best regards, 

Itay, MPO LIVE

1) What is the client ad spending budget on CI to Live? 15.000€

2) What is their budget for this live stream campaign in total (including pre-live, mid-live and post-live campaigns)? 15.000€
3) What time on 24 Feb will your client go live and for how long? Should be 8pm, discussing if they will do loops

4) What is your client plans for the live stream? They will cover the show

5) Have they gone live on TikTok before? Never

6) Will they hire production company to produce this live content? If not, whom is going to produce this? They already have one I guess, this is Vogue France
7) Have they run CI to LIVE campaign before? Never

8) Do they have an agency that has run CI to LIVE campaign before? No


Vogue/Condé Nast is a high potential publisher. It took me months to convince them to run a livestream and it took them a long time to negotiate it with a luxury house/brand. I am aware of the tight deadline. Negotiations ended very last minute unfortunately and I told them. However, this live is a 1st test for them and would open the door to many opportunities in the future as they will be able to pitch it to other clients and will know the how-to.

Thank you for sharing useful information, Marion.

 

The timing and short notice of your support request is challenging. On one hand, you put lots of efforts to make this activation happen, and we'd like to make sure your client has positive experience. On the other hand, my team is completely packed with other support request for fashion month that submitted well in advance. Only on Saturday the 24th we are already supporting two other fashion live streams (and we usually do not provide weekend support). 


After consideration, I can offer limited Scaled Support plus. This support will include: 

  • Guiding you on the steps you need to take before your client live stream.
  • A consultation video call with your client. The following stakeholder from the client side must attend this meeting: the person who manages their TikTok account, the technical person from the production company that will stream the live content to TikTok, the person who will set up the CI to LIVE campaign). 
  • Review of their CI to LIVE campaign to make sure it is set up correctly (we will be able to review the campaign it is set at least 72 hours before your client goes live). 
  • Answering your questions. Longer response times might occur. 
  • My support will be provided on Athena.


Due to short notice request and lack of resources my support will NOT include: 

  • Monitoring their live stream during flight time.
  • Monitoring their CI to LIVE campaign on TTAM during flight time.
  • Real-time support during live stream flight time. 
  • Direct communication with your client (apart from our consultation call)


Please let me know if you are interested in such support. If you do, it is important to manage your client expectations on that. 


Looking forward to hearing from you. 


Best regards, 

Itay

Hi Itay, 


First of all, thank you so much. I am super aware of the challenge and I will let them know that next time, 4-3 weeks before would be the minimum + also, support on the week-end is not something possible in general.


I will share with them the support they will get and if they are happy with it we can schedule the consultation call?

Which time/day would work for you please?


Thank you so much again Itay.


Best regards,


Marion

Sure, Marion. I am happy to assist as much as I can under these circumstances. 


My availability for consultation call with your client appears on this link here (updates automatically). Please use this link to book the meeting. I don't have many slots left before the 24th. Hope we will find a suitable slot that works for your client. 


As mentioned above, for the most efficient call, it is essential for the following stakeholder to join the call:

  • The person who manages their TikTok account.
  • The technical person from the production company that will stream the live content to TikTok.
  • The person who will set up the CI to LIVE campaign).


Zoom link to join the call (you can share this with your client):

https://vcp.to/TikTokZoom1


Best, 

Itay

Thank you Itay, I shared it with them and I will call them this afternoon to make sure its 100% clear for them and make sure they book a slot in your calendar.


Best,


Marion

Thanks, Marion. 

I would suggest that you book a slot for them and also join our call, as you know best your client's needs.

Best,

Itay

Hi Marlon, here are internal actions you should take for your client: 


1) Allowlist CI to Live - To use Community Interaction to Live, you will need to allowlist your client (it's still in Beta). Please add the client's details to the following list. Here: CI to LIVE - Allowlist Request tracker. More information about CI to Live here: [Commdoc] Community Interaction to LIVE (Beta)

Process time: 5 working days


2) TnS protection - you already applied for protection. Process times are longer due to the Chinese New Year holiday. No further action it required at the moment.


3) MI exemption - As you might know, all adverts are being reviewed by MI to meet the TikTok advertising policy. In CI to Live the advert creative is the live stream. To avoid MI rejecting the campaign during the live stream's flight time, please apply for MI Exemption. Fill out this form: vcp.to/mi

Process time: 5-7 working days


4) OBS Access - your client will need a OBS LIVE/ RTMP access for their TT account (which means going live on TT using professional streaming software). We will talk about in our consultation call with them. Currently their account does not have this access, and you will need to apply for it. TT gives OBS LIVE access for 7 days, therefore you should apply 6 days before they go live (please apply on Monday). Video guide on how to apply here. Doc here.

Process time: 2-4 working days


Let me know if you have any questions. 


Best, 

Itay

Hi Itay,


I just called my client. He will book a slot.


He had 2 questions :

  • They have a 15k€ budget, do you know if they could put 10k€ for the live and 5k€ in the teasing or post-show phase (I told him he will do loop so the live can last for a long time and spend the 10k€)
  • Do we have any benchmark about how many views they could get the 24th at 8pm for the show (I checked and it seems we dont have many... but in case you have something I dont have to "forecast" the number of views).


Thank you

We recommend live stream to be at least 1 hour for the CI to LIVE to be effective. Many fashion clients go live for 2-4 hours by looping their fashion show. Others produce per-show/post show content. If they are planning to loop their content, 10K Euro is most likely to be spent. We have clients with 6 figures budget on CI to LIVE. 


Forecasting views is tricky since it is based on many different parameters such as content quality, ad budget, targeted audience, competing campaigns, number of followers and more. 


I am sharing benchmark doc from last year. This is the only benchmark doc we have.  

https://bytedance.sg.larkoffice.com/sheets/shtlg7wnMBivIJizUurFTC2k02b?sheet=8a2f99


Best, 

Itay

Hi Itay,



1) Allowlist CI to Live
 - I allowed-listed my client a while ago. It appears on their ads manager


2) TnS protection - ok


3) MI exemption - I just applied. However, the campaign is not created yet so I couldn't fill it and also (I think it was requested for the TNS form) I don't have access to the UID. So I just wrote @voguefrance. Is it a problem? 



4) OBS Access - Well noted, it will be my 1st priority on Monday.


Thank you so much for your support and the benchmark.


Best,


Marion

Hi Marion, 


Your client UID is 99570493388673024

Handle: voguefrance


You will need to apply with UID both for TnS protection and MI Exemption. More important is TnS protection application since TnS protection is provided based on UID only. I would recommend reapplying to avoid delays once the relevant handling teams are back from the Chinese New Year holidays. They will have long queues. 


You can leave the Campaign ID blank for now. Once your client set up CI to LIVE campaign on TTAM, please send me its campaign ID. 


A consultation meeting has been scheduled for this Friday at 2pm London time. We might need more than 30 minutes. Therefore, I'm reserving additional 15 minutes for your client. 


Let me know if you have any questions. 


Best, 

Itay

Hi Itay, Thank you so much, I resubmit the ticket now. Thank you for the meeting tomorrow.


Best,


Marion

Morning Itay,


Hope you are well and had a great week-end.


I have 3 questions :


1) The luxury brand will have his own production team, they will give them they URL+key.

My client will display on TikTok for the brand through his account (vogue paris).

Should I apply for OBS (TikTok M10N) or Live Studio (TikTok M10N)?


2) My client would like to do a preview/test if I grant access to OBS/Live studio, we he be able to test a livestream launch with the luxury brand? (even if there is no protection)

3) Also, for the live event anchor, they tried to create it using the Vogue account but it posted a video without creating the event. (the event should only be displayed on the profile right? And if they dont want to get the video on their feed, they can go on the set up and "hide it"? 

Thank you,


Marion

Hi Marion, 

Thanks for your questions. Here are my answers: 


1) The luxury brand will have his own production team, they will give them they URL+key.

My client will display on TikTok for the brand through his account (vogue paris).

Should I apply for OBS (TikTok M10N) or Live Studio (TikTok M10N)?

Basically, they will need OBS (TikTok M10N) access not the LIVE Studio access. However, I would recommend you apply for both of them just in case. 


2) My client would like to do a preview/test if I grant access to OBS/Live studio, we he be able to test a livestream launch with the luxury brand? (even if there is no protection)
I recommend running tests on a separate account, not on their main brand account. For this they need to create a new account on TT then give you the details. You should apply for OBS LIVE access for this test account. You can also apply for LIVE STUDIO access, although they don't need it. 

This test account won't be protected, but since it's just test account, the risk is low even if they get issues with TnS. 


3) Also, for the live event anchor, they tried to create it using the Vogue account but it posted a video without creating the event. (the event should only be displayed on the profile right? And if they dont want to get the video on their feed, they can go on the set up and "hide it"? 

usually when creating event anchor, it appears on their bio page. If adding a video to the event anchor, this video will automatically be posted on their feed. They can try to hide it and see if it is then displayed only on the event page and not in the feed. For these testing I'd recommend using the test account as well. 

More info about Event Anchor here (with useful links). 


I am attaching guides that you can share with your client: 

  1. how to create Stream Key to go live (the topic I demonstrated in our call on Friday) 
  2. how to create event anchor


Hope this is useful. 


Best, 

Itay

content.file_name: Go LIVE on TikTok via Browser 2024 - Q1.pdf
How to Schedule a LIVE Event on TikTok.mp4

items.content:
Hi Itay,


Thank you! Super clear! I created a ticket for both (OBS+live studio).

All your answers help me a lot.


Best,


Marion

Your requests for OBS LIVE access and LIVE Studio have been approved. 

If they need their test account to be approved, you should apply the same way you applied for the main account. 

I would strongly recommend them run tests on their test account. 

Best, 

Itay

Hi Itay,


Thank you! 


My client asked me a few questions about the organic live anchor event :

  • If the show is late. The users who signed up through the live event anchor will receive a notification at 8:15pm (even if the show was supposed to start at 8pm)
  • The brand would like to delete/hide the video which teases the show. Would it delete the people who signed up to attend the show through the live event anchor. Conde Nast asks if they should just hide this video once the live done.


Thank you,


Marion

Itay,


They put me in a loop where I can see that the brand would like them to use these interests :

"MF 18-54, interested in luxury hotels, clothing and accessories, bags, watches, high end jewelry, women's clothing, women's clothing, women's shoes, business class, givenchy, luxury jewelry, luxury fashion, fashion, leather bags, leather shoes, Fendi, Louis Vuitton, Celine, Prada, Dior, Versace, Valentino, Givenchy, Bally, Mulberry, Tom Ford, Giorgio Armani, Karl Lagerfeld, Burberry, Balenciaga, Loewe, leather keywords, Margot Robbie, Kendall Jenner, Rihanna,"

We agree that "broad" would be better no? (or broad women/broad men)

Last (sorry message). Would you have the UID for this account @clemablement please? I no longer have access to Mint to check it.

This is the account they would like to use to do their tests.

Thank you

@clemablement

UID: 6646885674833264646


This account does not have OBS LIVE access. You can apply for access for this test account the same way you applied for the main account. 


Another issue I'd like to highlight: in our call, they mentioned that they didn't have the password for their main account and they could not restore it since the email address they used to sign up was not active anymore. Currently they use the QR code sign in option to log in to their desktop web TT account. You can try to assist them to restore their password by getting in touch with the Global User Operation team (search 'GUO help desk' on Lark). 


Hope this is helpful. 


Best, 

Itay

Hi Itay,


Thank you so much and I will check with their password!

I will keep you posted.


Best,


Marion

Hi Marion, 

They have access both for OBS LIVE and LIVE Studio. However as we discussed in our call, they should use the OBS LIVE access, which means streaming to TikTok using third party streaming software. 

Attached is the guide again on how to stream to TikTok. 

Let me know if they still have issues. 

Best, 

Itay

content.file_name: Go LIVE on TikTok via Browser 2024 - Q1.pdf

items.content:
Morning Itay,

They told me they can't see the live studio on their Vogue France account but as you can see attached, it was approved...

Thank you for your help

Hi Itay,

Thank you! They have access they told me.

I asked them to run some tests.

Best,

Marion

Morning Itay,


Here is a question from Clemence :

"For the live show, if the paid operator needs to create a 2-hour loop so that the live show loops,

Do I have to stay in front of my screen for 2 hours and end the live (red button) after the 2 hours?

Or is it independent and I can turn off the button when the live is really over?"


I believe she has nothing to do as the live will be on when it is recorded and it is linked to OBS but maybe I am wrong.


Thank you Itay,


Marion

Hi Marion, 


"For the live show, if the paid operator needs to create a 2-hour loop so that the live show loops,

Do I have to stay in front of my screen for 2 hours and end the live (red button) after the 2 hours?

Or is it independent and I can turn off the button when the live is really over?"


YES, she will have to stay with her browser open for the entire 2 hour loop and hit the red button once the loop is over. Otherwise, the account will stay in LIVE status, showing buffering icon animation.

Hi Itay,


Ok, thank you so much :)


Best,


Marion

Itay,


Clemence asks "I'll stay on live for the duration of the loop then.

Who will inform me when it's over? The paid manager or the production agency?"


(I think I have so many questions for my 1st live that I will be able to answer to many without asking you for the next one. Sorry for all the questions).


Thank you,


Marion

Hi Marion, 


Clemence asks "I'll stay on live for the duration of the loop then.

Who will inform me when it's over? The paid manager or the production agency?"


In most live stream we support, there social media manager is coordinated with the production team on site and the media agency. They all decide together when to end up the live stream. The agency point of view is to make sure all budget was spent. Once agree, the production team waits for the right time on the content to end the live (usually at the end of one looped catwalk), and then they stopped feeding the TT account. Once that happened the social media manager hit the red end button to end the live on the TT account. 


Some clients provide the login credential to their production team, and they take care of ending up the live feed and the hitting the red end button. 


It is up to the client to decide how to do that, but they must be coordinated. 


Generally, in your client case, I'm a bit concerned of lack of coordination between the social media manager and the production team on site. We didn't have a chance to meet the production company in our call. Hope your client are coordinated with the production team.


Best, 

Itay

Thank you Itay!

Makes sens.


Yes... Condé Nast is big, there are many people involved in the project and they decided to do this live very last minute.

Hopefully, next time will be different.

After this livestream, I will share with them the best practices regarding organization and I will know way more about this topic myself so I'll be prepared for the next one.

Great. Let's hope that everything goes well in this live stream on Saturday. 

If you need my help after this live stream to jump in to a call with your client to discuss best practices, let me know.

Best, 

Itay

Hi Itay,


Thank you for your support! I'll let you know but would be great. 


  • All the authorizations were granted (TNS, CI to live, MI exemption, OBS/Live studio)
  • The live event anchor is live
  • The campaign is set up in the ads manager (https://ads.tiktok.com/i18n/perf/adgroup?aadvid=6909099191968989185&keyword=1791612517697538&et=2024-02-22&st=2024-02-15)

Now I cross my fingers and I hope they will be well-coordinated on Saturday.


Best,


Marion

Hi Marion, 


Thank you for this information. 


I reviewed their CI to LIVE campaign on TTAM. 


The start time set on TTAM in 19:30 CET. Could you confirm this is their start time? The live anchor on thier account states that live stream is schedule for 20:00 CET. 


The duration is set for 2h15min. I am just making sure they will be live on their account for this duration, and that they are going to loop their catwalk immediately once the live catwalk is over. Their production company is responsible for looping their content and continue streaming on TT. 


The person who manages their TT account (Clemence) should not mistakenly end the live by clicking the red end button after the live catwalk and before they start the looping.


Let me know if you have any questions. 


Best, 

Itay

Hi Itay,


The show should start around 8:30pm (originally 8pm but they think it will start at 8:30pm) CET.

Ok, very clear for the loop, I will send them a reminder email.


Thank you,


Marion

Morning Itay, hope you are well and had a great weekend! 


I attended the livestream and it was amazing, they did a kind of pre-show then loops!

I saw they got 55k unique views but I was wondering if I could have access to the OBS report/organic report please?

They got 5.8M impressions but I am not sure if it includes the organic views.


Please : find attached the screenshot of the performance + 2 screenshots of the show :)


Thank you

Hi Marion, 


Hope you had a nice weekend. I monitored some of the live stream yesterday, and saw it performed well. 


The data that you see on TTAM is for the paid media only. The client can see their live metrics of all traffic on their TikTok Live Center Analytics. However, you do not have access to this data. I will be able to send you these metrics, hopefully by end of play tomorrow or early Wednesday. 


Best, 

Itay

Hi Itay,


Ok, thank you so much! I look forward to discovering this data.


Have a nice day,


Marion

Hi Marion, 


Here are the metrics for the client's live stream.


Live name: Bottega Veneta Winter 24 Show

Live start time: 2024-02-24 19:19:39

Live end time: 2024-02-24 21:06:36

Unique viewers: 63,050

Total views: 69,087

Top viewer count: 1,676

New followers: 871

Likes: 108,152 

Comment count: 0

Share: 950

Gifts: 0


*These metrics are for the actual live streaming page on TikTok (not the 'For You' page), whether the viewer came from paid campaign or organically.

Let me know if you have any questions, 


Best, 

Itay

Hi Itay,


Thank you so much!!!

I will have a look! 


Best,


Marion

Itay,

Are top viewers the users who stayed in the live room for at least 10 seconds please?

Also, should I share this data with my client or they received it from their side?

Thank you,

Marion

Hi Marion, 

Are top viewers the users who stayed in the live room for at least 10 seconds please?

No. it's the maximum number of viewers at the same time. It means that there was a moment on this live stream that 1,676 viewers were watching the live stream at the same time. Users viewing their live stream at a specific point in time. 


Also, should I share this data with my client or they received it from their side?

You can share this metrics with your client if you are interested. 

Best, 

Itay

Hi Itay


Thank you very much!


Best,


Marion

Hi Marion, 

Thank you for using MPO end-to-end live streaming consultation service. Our support for this live stream has ended. Hope you found my service helpful.

If you have any questions regarding this live stream, please feel free to reopen this ticket.

We will be happy to support you again in future live stream. Please request our support here (at least 2 weeks before going live, the sooner the better). 

Best regards, 

Itay, MPO LIVE

items.content:
Here is my client's message :
I can confirm that we've got the GO to sponsor the livestream on Vogue. The date is set for February 24.
I'm setting up this e-mail loop with our Vogue editorial teams (Marie and Clémence) and the video team (Thomas, with whom you already spoke on our Friday call, and Agathe and Edouard from his team) to move forward as quickly as possible on setting up this operation.
So, could you remind us of the operational next-steps and the imperatives/emergencies to be managed on the production side (on your side and ours)?
On the amp side, we can call each other if need be, but normally that's not the most urgent thing, is it? :)
